subject: Creativity
title: Sleep Deprivation Kills Creativity
description: A short lesson to help you apply Sleep Deprivation Kills Creativity.

hook.text: The myth of the sleepless creative genius is dangerous. Sleep deprivation devastates creative thinking.

buildup.text: After 24 hours without sleep, divergent thinking drops by 50%. Flexible reasoning nearly vanishes.

twist.text: Many famous 'sleepless geniuses' actually napped frequently. Edison slept 3 hours at night â€” plus daily naps.

climax.text: Sleep is when the brain consolidates creative insights. Skip it, and today's ideas never become tomorrow's.

punchline.text: Sleep isn't the enemy of productivity. It's the engine of creativity.
